issue.title: Anvil reverts with invalid FE opcode even though the opcode is not run.
issue.body:
### Component

Anvil

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [ ] Foundry
- [ ] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

anvil 0.2.0 (5be158b 2023-10-02T00:23:45.472182000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

Running specific smart contract code

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

I'm using cannon to develop some contracts. Cannon uses Anvil to run them.

When I run the code on the Hardhat network, everything succeeds. When I run it on Anvil, I get an `InvalidFEOpcode` error even though the FE Opcode is not being run. Full error:
```
 Error: transaction reverted in contract unknown: processing response error (body="{\"jsonrpc\":\"2.0\",\"id\":53,\"error\":{\"code\":-32603,\"message\":\"EVM error InvalidFEOpcode\"}}", error={"code":-32603}, requestBody="{\"method\":\"eth_estimateGas\",\"params\":[{\"type\":\"0x2\",\"maxFeePerGas\":\"0xd09dc300\",\"maxPriorityFeePerGas\":\"0x59682f00\",\"from\":\"0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266\",\"to\":\"0xe661b3f15d0310af885f4d5c6482c0b5a8c0523d\",\"data\":\"\"}],\"id\":53,\"jsonrpc\":\"2.0\"}", requestMethod="POST", url="http://127.0.0.1:8545", code=SERVER_ERROR, version=web/5.7.1)
```

## Reproduction Repo

Including a more in-depth explanation is here: https://github.com/CoinageCrypto/anvil-revert-issue

comment.body:
> Downloading compiler 0.8.21
> Error HH502: Couldn't download compiler version list. Please check your internet connection and try again.

We've noticed today that compiler cannot be downloaded, that looks like something on hardhat end perhaps?

issue.title: forge test can't find the contract
issue.body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (58a2729 2023-05-15T00:04:23.550925000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

My contract file is in `/Users/j/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive/n/nd/blockchain_assets/contracts/p/contract.sol`.
My test file is in `/Users/j/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive/n/nd/contract_unit_tests/p/test/contract_t.sol`
In the test file, I import contract file using:
`import "../../../blockchain_assets/contracts/p/contract.sol";`
When i run `forge test`,
I get error:
`Source "blockchain_assets/contracts/p/t.sol" not found: File not found. Searched the following locations: "/Users/j/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive/n/nd/contract_unit_tests/p".
 --> test/plonk_vk_jellyfish_t.sol:6:1:
  |
6 | import "../../../blockchain_assets/contracts/p/contract.sol";`
But if i use the full path of contract.sol, i won't get this error.

I also checked fs-permission in /Usersj/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive/n/nd/contract_unit_tests/p/foundry.toml, 
I have fs_permissions = [{ access = "read", path = "./"},
{ access = "read", path = "../../blockchain_assets/contracts/p/"}], if I understand it correctly, this should give forge permission to read all files in blockchain_assets/contracts/p.

issue.title: `internal error: entered unreachable code: We should never have decoded calldata for contract creations`
issue.body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

`forge 0.2.0 (93f64c7 2023-10-27T00:24:49.496418315Z)`

### What command(s) is the bug in?

`forge test`

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

Multiple times during CI runs I face the following error ([example](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/createx/actions/runs/6664854666/job/18113729646?pr=18#step:12:5118))

```bash
Running 1 test for test/invariants/CreateX_Invariants.t.sol:CreateX_Invariants
[PASS] statefulFuzz_EtherBalance() (runs: 5000, calls: 75000, reverts: 74998)
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  internal error: entered unreachable code: We should never have decoded calldata for contract creations
Location: crates/evm/traces/src/lib.rs:262
```

I'm doing an invariant test on my create factory [here](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/createx/blob/create3-tests/test/invariants/CreateX_Invariants.t.sol). The issue as it seems is that for certain `initCode` inputs (i.e. decoded calldata) it panics. It's getting pretty annoying lately tbh. Any way to disable this in my test environment?

release.name: Nightly (2023-10-27)
release.body:
## Other

- test: add forge create test (#6137)
- fix(`common`): properly parse functions in their usual form (#6136)
- fix: print decoded output value (#6141)

Other

  • test: add forge create test (#6137)
  • fix(common): properly parse functions in their usual form (#6136)
  • fix: print decoded output value (#6141)

commits.message:
fix(`common`): properly parse functions in their usual form (#6136)

* fix: properly parse functions in their usual form

* chore: fmt

* chore: add test

* chore: only fallback to human-readable abi if necessary

* chore: add another function for test

issue.title: Cast fails to parse signature after update
issue.body:
After going from `cast 0.2.0 (ba6c851 2023-10-23T00:25:30.528411000Z)` to `cast 0.2.0 (93f64c7 2023-10-27T00:23:01.290541000Z)`, I can't use some previously working signatures with `cast send` anymore.

Errors:
```
$ cast send --private-key 0x2771aff413cac48d9f8c114fabddd9195a2129f3c2c436caa07e27bb7f58ead5 0xefb84935239dacdecf7c5ba76d8de40b077b7b33 'function addOracle(address token, address oracleAddress) external' 0x000000000000000000000000000000000000ce16 0x42cf1bbc38BaAA3c4898ce8790e21eD2738c6A4a
parser error:
function addOracle(address token, address oracleAddress) external
          ^
expected `(`
```
```
$ cast send --private-key 0x2771aff413cac48d9f8c114fabddd9195a2129f3c2c436caa07e27bb7f58ead5 0x471ece3750da237f93b8e339c536989b8978a438 'function transfer(address to, uint256 value) external returns (bool)' 0x000000000000000000000000000000000000dEaD 100
parser error:
function transfer(address to, uint256 value) external returns (bool)
          ^
expected `(`
```
Since these worked before and I don't see anything wrong with the signatures, I assume this is a regression in cast.

OS: macOS 14.0 23A344

pull_request.title: fix(`common`): properly parse functions in their usual form
pull_request.body:
Closes #6135 

Alloy's `Function` only parses functions without their return arguments and without the `function` prefix. We can use `AbiItem::parse` to parse them as human-readable abi strings and get a `Function` in return.

repo.name: foundry
repo.description: Foundry is a blazing fast, portable and modular toolkit for Ethereum application development written in Rust.

repo.name: foundry
repo.description: Foundry is a blazing fast, portable and modular toolkit for Ethereum application development written in Rust.

pull_request.title: fix(`common`): properly parse functions in their usual form
pull_request.body:
Closes #6135 

Alloy's `Function` only parses functions without their return arguments and without the `function` prefix. We can use `AbiItem::parse` to parse them as human-readable abi strings and get a `Function` in return.

issue.title: `internal error: entered unreachable code: We should never have decoded calldata for contract creations`
issue.body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

`forge 0.2.0 (93f64c7 2023-10-27T00:24:49.496418315Z)`

### What command(s) is the bug in?

`forge test`

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

Multiple times during CI runs I face the following error ([example](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/createx/actions/runs/6664854666/job/18113729646?pr=18#step:12:5118))

```bash
Running 1 test for test/invariants/CreateX_Invariants.t.sol:CreateX_Invariants
[PASS] statefulFuzz_EtherBalance() (runs: 5000, calls: 75000, reverts: 74998)
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  internal error: entered unreachable code: We should never have decoded calldata for contract creations
Location: crates/evm/traces/src/lib.rs:262
```

I'm doing an invariant test on my create factory [here](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/createx/blob/create3-tests/test/invariants/CreateX_Invariants.t.sol). The issue as it seems is that for certain `initCode` inputs (i.e. decoded calldata) it panics. It's getting pretty annoying lately tbh. Any way to disable this in my test environment?

comment.body:
okay that's the same bug, yeah.

so the bug here is actually pretty simple that we just didn't handle the case where we were able to decode the constructor calldata

this panic is now removed with #5629, so no more crashes here

issue.title: Bug: `internal error: entered unreachable code: We should never have decoded calldata for contract creation`
issue.body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

`forge 0.2.0 (93ebcdd 2023-08-15T00:21:30.341654717Z)`

### What command(s) is the bug in?

`FOUNDRY_PROFILE=ci forge test --out forge-artifacts`

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

I get the following error if I execute the following command `FOUNDRY_PROFILE=ci forge test --out forge-artifacts`:

```bash
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  internal error: entered unreachable code: We should never have decoded calldata for contract creations
Location: crates/evm/src/trace/mod.rs:248

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

Backtrace omitted. Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 environment variable to display it.
Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=full to include source snippets.
Aborted
 ELIFECYCLE  Command failed with exit code 134.
```

My repository is private, unfortunately, and I'm not sure how I can share a repro best.

### Component

`forge 0.2.0 (93f64c7 2023-10-27T00:24:49.496418315Z)`

`forge test`

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

Multiple times during CI runs I face the following error ([example](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/createx/actions/runs/6664854666/job/18113729646?pr=18#step:12:5118))

```bash

```

I'm doing an invariant test on my create factory [here](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/createx/blob/create3-tests/test/invariants/CreateX_Invariants.t.sol). The issue as it seems is that for certain `initCode` inputs (i.e. decoded calldata) it panics. It's getting pretty annoying lately tbh. Any way to disable this in my test environment?

comment.body:
looks like we're decoding init code now, so I'm removing the unreachable

https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/pull/6141

this shouldn't be there anyway

repo.name: foundry
repo.description: A drop-in replacement for `dapp` and `seth` in Rust

repo.name: foundry
repo.description: Foundry is a blazing fast, portable and modular toolkit for Ethereum application development written in Rust.

issue.title: `internal error: entered unreachable code: We should never have decoded calldata for contract creations`
issue.body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

`forge 0.2.0 (93f64c7 2023-10-27T00:24:49.496418315Z)`

### What command(s) is the bug in?

`forge test`

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

Multiple times during CI runs I face the following error ([example](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/createx/actions/runs/6664854666/job/18113729646?pr=18#step:12:5118))

```bash
Running 1 test for test/invariants/CreateX_Invariants.t.sol:CreateX_Invariants
[PASS] statefulFuzz_EtherBalance() (runs: 5000, calls: 75000, reverts: 74998)
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  internal error: entered unreachable code: We should never have decoded calldata for contract creations
Location: crates/evm/traces/src/lib.rs:262
```

I'm doing an invariant test on my create factory [here](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/createx/blob/create3-tests/test/invariants/CreateX_Invariants.t.sol). The issue as it seems is that for certain `initCode` inputs (i.e. decoded calldata) it panics. It's getting pretty annoying lately tbh. Any way to disable this in my test environment?

comment.body: @mattsse we'll have to triage—this unreachable was already there from the previous implementation. Possible that the issue might come from another place

issue.title: Anvil reverts with invalid FE opcode even though the opcode is not run.
issue.body:
### Component

Anvil

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [ ] Foundry
- [ ] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

anvil 0.2.0 (5be158b 2023-10-02T00:23:45.472182000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

Running specific smart contract code

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

I'm using cannon to develop some contracts. Cannon uses Anvil to run them.

When I run the code on the Hardhat network, everything succeeds. When I run it on Anvil, I get an `InvalidFEOpcode` error even though the FE Opcode is not being run. Full error:
```
 Error: transaction reverted in contract unknown: processing response error (body="{\"jsonrpc\":\"2.0\",\"id\":53,\"error\":{\"code\":-32603,\"message\":\"EVM error InvalidFEOpcode\"}}", error={"code":-32603}, requestBody="{\"method\":\"eth_estimateGas\",\"params\":[{\"type\":\"0x2\",\"maxFeePerGas\":\"0xd09dc300\",\"maxPriorityFeePerGas\":\"0x59682f00\",\"from\":\"0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266\",\"to\":\"0xe661b3f15d0310af885f4d5c6482c0b5a8c0523d\",\"data\":\"\"}],\"id\":53,\"jsonrpc\":\"2.0\"}", requestMethod="POST", url="http://127.0.0.1:8545", code=SERVER_ERROR, version=web/5.7.1)
```

## Reproduction Repo

Including a more in-depth explanation is here: https://github.com/CoinageCrypto/anvil-revert-issue

comment.body:
thanks for flagging 

https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/pull/6140 should fix it

I was unable to run the example, unclear how I can run this against a local anvil instance, only got errors with `pnpm t -- --network hardhat`

```
pnpm t -- --network hardhat                                                                                    

> synthetix-sandbox-trading-example@0.0.1 test /Users/Matthias/git/rust/forge-repros/anvil-revert-issue
> hardhat test "--network" "hardhat"

Downloading compiler 0.8.21
Error HH502: Couldn't download compiler version list. Please check your internet connection and try again.

For more info go to https://hardhat.org/HH502 or run Hardhat with --show-stack-traces
 ELIFECYCLE  Test failed. See above for more details.
```

could you perhaps check the PR directly?
